subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Ahhh the infamous Fish!
author: black bear hollow
full_text:
What difference would a recording make? Especially
Since in this research where we usually can't see who or what
we're talking to. Any voice we hear or record could be anything.

W

On Aug 18, 2008, at 4:32 PM, "threadsintyme@..." <Threadsintyme@... 
 > wrote:

> I wonder the same thing myself...does anyone have any recordings of  
> them that can be listened to?
>
> Al
>
> -- Lisby <lisby@...> wrote:
>
> I've heard of this as well, but my question was, do we have any EVP  
> evidence that the *Fish Group* ever claimed to be other than dead  
> people?
>
>
> Ann
>
> On Aug 18, 2008, at 1:58 AM, threadsintyme@... wrote:
>
>>
>> Wisteria,
>>
>> I forgot but you may be quite right! There are spirits who have  
>> never been incarnated into human form. They tend not to be involved  
>> in any way with lower forms of vibration.
>>
>> Edgar Cayce spoke of them. Their souls were created as the moment  
>> of Creation. They chose not to have ever incarnated. Since their  
>> vibration level is far more than a lowly entity, I highly doubt  
>> that they would interact with lower entities. They are on a  
>> completely different level of existence.
>>
>> Al
>>
>> -- black bear hollow <blackbearhollow@...> wrote:
>>
>> I just said that in reference to Al's comments. There are a cluster  
>> of researchers who insist on tagging religious myth on research...  
>> angels, devils, heaven, hell, assuming anything visiting our plane  
>> is "stuck" and needs "saving" and ignoring other energies assuming  
>> everything they hear is or was a human mortal.
>>
>>
>> Yes, I've heard from many energies claiming to be many things and  
>> some never having inhabited a body.
>>
>> Wisteria
>> On Aug 17, 2008, at 9:45 PM, Lisby wrote:
>>
>>> I said that because all of the examples I heard of EVP by the Fish  
>>> Group has sounded very human and they have never claimed to have  
>>> been other than human that I have heard. I have to base my  
>>> conclusions on the EVP files, not speculation, even from the  
>>> victims. Do you know of instances where they audibly claimed to be  
>>> nonhuman? I may have missed them--I heard a lot of EVPs from them,  
>>> but certainly not the sum total. (As I said--I even got one myself  
>>> the other day.)
>>>
>>> I think you're right that they are definitely mobile, and a  
>>> collective.
>>>
>>> Ann
>>
>>
>>
>>
